summary: This is a memorandum from a BOP Regional Director to the Warden of MCC New York, notifying them of an After Action Review team's arrival to investigate the apparent suicide of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It lists the team members and requests logistical support from the facility staff.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the After Action Review, identified as an inmate who died by apparent suicide at MCC New York.

persons.name: Regional Director
persons.context: The author of the memorandum, who is sending the After Action Review team to MCC New York and will meet with the Warden.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: The recipient of the memorandum, who is instructed to prepare staff and resources for the arriving review team.

persons.name: Chief Psychologist
persons.context: Listed as a member of the After Action Review team being sent to investigate Epstein's death.

persons.name: Correctional Programs Administrator
persons.role: Correctional Programs Administrator, Correctional Programs Division, Central Office
persons.context: Listed as a member of the After Action Review team being sent to investigate Epstein's death.

persons.name: Associate Warden
persons.context: Listed as a member of the After Action Review team being sent to investigate Epstein's death.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: Listed as a member of the After Action Review team being sent to investigate Epstein's death.

connections.description: The Regional Director is issuing instructions to the Warden of MCC New York regarding the upcoming review.
The Chief Psychologist is listed as a member of the review team assembled by the Regional Director.
The Correctional Programs Administrator is listed as a member of the review team assembled by the Regional Director.
The Associate Warden is listed as a member of the review team assembled by the Regional Director.
The Captain is listed as a member of the review team assembled by the Regional Director.

events.title: After Action Review Team Arrival
events.description: A team of Bureau of Prisons staff is scheduled to arrive at MCC New York to begin an After Action Review of Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Apparent Suicide of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by apparent suicide while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: The Bureau of Prisons initiated an official 'After Action Review' of Jeffrey Epstein's death by apparent suicide.
The review team was scheduled to arrive at MCC New York on August 14, 2019, two days after this memo was written.
The memo instructs the Warden to have video and electronic records available for the team's independent review.
The team was composed of senior BOP staff from various facilities and divisions, including a Chief Psychologist and a Captain.
The memo anticipates potential union involvement, advising the Warden to notify the local union and have representation accessible.
